text: Amos Guttman (; 10 May 1954 – 16 February 1993) was a Romanian-born Israeli film director.Amos Guttman’s filmography (in Hebrew) He emigrated to Israel with his family, aged seven. He later became a successful film director. Being an openly gay man, he directed films in relation to his own personal life, such as Bar 51, Drifting and Amazing Grace. He was considered to be a pioneer of LGBT film in Israel.
